Let's think on the perspective of the laning phase what other ADC can fight xayah? She has 2 damage outputs the auto attacks and the feathers it allows her to burst as-well as do consistent dmg. The feathers are so easy to land it's like a lux E complex where dodging is just a matter of lux missing rather than you escaping the dmg. Caitlyn will basically miss 3 auto's during xayahs ult phase, she can dodge ashe's arrow and varus ult. Basically any adc bot that rely's on landing skills to do dmg will be at a disadvantage fighting her. Assassin's were already at an iffy spot atm she makes them worse, you either play kha zix or rengar now or nothing. As for mid is going to have to be Hard clickable CC so champs like lissandra. Also unlike other ADC's that some of their skill damage is converted to AP to reduce the damage all of her kit scales with AD at no toll.

to clear things up for you, you *also* mentioned:
>  since **adjustments **and reworks happen most every patch

> mysteries get reworked or items get adjustments

both simply alter a champion directly. through the incredibly large amount of data from champions before an "adjustment, mastery change, or item change", we can have a fairly accurate guess as to how it will place them after the changes.

As for a completely *new* champion(s) in which the only data we have from them is from a controlled environment full of players with no experience with said champions, there is next to no reliable data to form a judgement on. Even after a few days, the relative sample size is incredibly small and still unreliable.

That was the *point* of my comment, why you took it to the extremes so far as to twist it into looking like I was talking about *another* completely new aspect of the game is beyond me, I didn't think my comment was that difficult to understand?

Honestly, no offense to you, but I hate it when people suggest Blind Pick whenever someone mentions how annoying it is trying to play new champs. Blind Pick has never solved this problem. You'll [they'll] still have to worry about the other 4 players possibly picking/auto-locking the Champion(s) you [they] want to play. 

I don't even mind the fact that new champions get banned. What I mind is that new champions get banned IN NORMAL GAMES. See, Ranked games, I can understand banning them. Not because the new champion(s) may or may not be broken/op/etc, but simply because it's better to avoid having people attempting to 'first time' the new champion(s) in an environment where everyone is doing their best to win. Having someone 'first time' a Champion in Ranked automatically puts a burden on the team they're on.

However, in NORMAL GAMES, sure people still want to win, but it's not as serious an environment as Ranked games. More often than not, people are playing Normals to learn/practice/improve on their Champion(s) for use in Ranked play. The problem with that, though, is that if said people want to try learning the new champions, said champion either gets banned (by the opposing team; or even their OWN TEAM) OR someone on the opposing team gets it first.

It's almost impossible to learn about how to use a new champion(s), let alone, learn how to fight against it [them], if everyone is banning it [them]. This is where my concern comes in.

Blind Pick could potentially be a fix to this, if they just added role choices to it. Like, make people queue into it the same way they would Normal Draft, by letting them choose 2 roles. Only difference would be that once they got into champion select, there'd still be no ban phase, and you just pick whatever champion you feel like playing. That way, no one would have to worry about auto-lock, (as much), because you'd have to select a champion based on the role you queued for. (Unless you're one of those people who choose whatever you want, but it's still Blind Pick, so that wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing.)

Here is something you need to realize -- Normals is not PBE. Many people play normals just to have fun, not to test a new champion. Maybe they don't want to play vs that champ. Maybe they have faced it x many times and are tired of it. Maybe they are broken. Maybe they main someone who that champion counters. They shouldn't need to stop playing the game or reduce their fun if they don't want to play with a certain champion open (which is one of the points of playing draft).

Many players aren't playing to practice for Ranked, and don't care (and shouldn't need to) about you using Normal games as a tool to prepare for Ranked. You are playing to improve. They are playing for fun. Why should they have to cater to you? They are a member of the team just as much as you are. 

Blind pick is used by most people for testing new champions for a reason. You can't seriously expect to get the new champion every game you load into in Draft. Theres 6 bans, and up to 9 people higher pick priority than you, and any of the 5 of the enemy team could be the same role as you and take the champ. Granted, that would still give you experience against the champion, but still. 
There isn't a real answer to practice the champ outside of customs or playing with a premade and the game shouldn't be shaped around trying to play new champs once every few patches they are released.
